title: 2006 DFL-Ligapokal Final
text:
The 2006 DFL-Ligapokal Final decided the winner of the <a href="2006%20DFL-Ligapokal">2006 DFL-Ligapokal</a>, the 10th edition of the reiterated <a href="DFL-Ligapokal">DFL-Ligapokal</a>, a knockout <a href="Association%20football">football</a> cup competition.
The match was played on 5 August 2006 at the <a href="Red%20Bull%20Arena%20%28Leipzig%29">Zentralstadion</a> in <a href="Leipzig">Leipzig</a>. <a href="SV%20Werder%20Bremen">Werder Bremen</a> won the match 2–0 against <a href="FC%20Bayern%20Munich">Bayern Munich</a> for their 1st title.
Teams.
"In the following table, finals until 2004 were in the DFB-Ligapokal era, since 2005 were in the DFL-Ligapokal era."
Route to the final.
The DFL-Ligapokal is a six team <a href="single-elimination%20tournament">single-elimination</a> knockout cup competition. There are a total of two rounds leading up to the final. Four teams enter the preliminary round, with the two winners advancing to the semi-finals, where they will be joined by two additional clubs who were given a bye. For all matches, the winner after 90 minutes advances. If still tied, <a href="Overtime%20%28sports%29%23Association%20football">extra time</a>, and if necessary <a href="Penalty%20shoot-out%20%28association%20football%29">penalties</a> are used to determine the winner.
